actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore a capital gains differential for small and high-risk business stock held for more than 5 years.
short_title: Small and High-Risk Business Investment Act of 1989

summary.text: Small and High-Risk Business Investment Act of 1989 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish alternative tax rates for capital gains on small and high-risk business stock held by noncorporate taxpayers. Requires such stock to be held for a minimum of five years. Establishes an alternative tax for any corporation that has a small business stock net capital gain. Treats the rate differential portion of capital gains on the sale of certain small and high-risk business stock as an item of tax preference under the alternative minimum tax.

titles.title: Small and High-Risk Business Investment Act of 1989
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore a capital gains differential for small and high-risk business stock held for more than 5 years.
